tuv.seg: Court proceedings for recovering debts
Imeachtaí cúirte chun fiachais a aisghabháil
Most court proceedings in relation to debt are civil proceedings
Tá an chuid is mó d’imeachtaí cúirte maidir le fiachas ina n-imeachtaí sibhialta
You may be eligible for civil legal aid if you pass the means test and if your case is likely to succeed
D'fhéadfá a bheith incháilithe do chúnamh dlí sibhialta dá n-éireodh leat sa tástáil acmhainne agus dá mbeadh gach cosúlacht ann go n-éireodh le do chás
If you accept that you owe the debt and that you have no defence to the claim, then your case is unlikely to succeed and you would not get civil legal aid
Má ghlacann tú go bhfuil an fiachas ort agus nach bhfuil aon chosaint agat in aghaidh an éilimh, ní dócha go n-éireodh le do chás agus ní gheobhaidh tú cúnamh dlí sibhialta
If a judgment order is made against you, you are usually liable for the costs incurred by your creditor in taking the case
Más rud é go ndéanfar ordú breithiúnais i do choinne, beidh tú faoi dhliteanas na gcostas arna dtabhú ag do chreidiúnaí i dtógáil an cháis
These costs are added to the amount of the judgment and can be enforced against you as part of the enforcement of the judgment
Tá na costais seo curtha le méid an bhreithiúnais agus is féidir iad a chur i bhfeidhm i do choinne mar chuid de fhorghníomhú an bhreithiúnais
If you fail to pay an instalment order and you are summonsed to court for committal proceedings, you are eligible for criminal legal aid
Má theipeann ort ordú tráthchoda a íoc agus má ghairtear ort teacht chun na cúirte le haghaidh imeachtaí cimithe, tá tú i dteideal cúnamh dlí coiriúil
The decision on whether or not you get such aid is made by the judge dealing with the committal proceedings
Is é an breitheamh atá ag déileáil leis na himeachtaí cimithe a dhéanann an cinneadh maidir le cibé acu an bhfaigheann tú an cúnamh nó nach bhfaigheann
Court procedures for judgment
Nósanna imeachta na gCúirteanna i leith breithiúnas a fháil
If you fail to pay a debt, your creditor is likely to go to court in order to get a court judgment that you owe the debt and then enforce that judgment
Má theipeann ort fiachas a íoc, is dócha go dtéann do chreidiúnaí chun na cúirte chun breithiúnas cúirte a fháil go bhfuil fiachas ort, agus an breithiúnas sin a chur i bhfeidhm ansin

• If you owe less than €15,000, the court proceedings must be brought in the District Court; proceedings are started when the creditor issues you with a claim notice; the procedure is governed by the District Court Rules

• Má tá níos lú ná €15,000 ort, caithfidh na himeachtaí cúirte a thionól sa Chúirt Dúiche; cuirfear tús le himeachtaí nuair a eiseoidh an creidiúnaí Toghairm Shibhialta duit; tá an nós imeachta seo faoi réir Rialacha Cúirte Dúiche

• If you owe between €15,000 and €75,000, the court proceedings must be brought in the Circuit Court; proceedings are started when the creditor serves you with an Ordinary Civil Bill; the procedure is governed by the Rules of the Circuit Court

• Má tá idir €15,000 agus €75,000 ort, ní mór na himeachtaí cúirte a thionól sa Chúirt Chuarda; cuirfear tús le himeachtaí nuair a dhéanfaidh an creidiúnaí Gnáthbhille Sibhialta a sheirbheáil ort; tá an nós imeachta seo faoi réir Rialacha na Cúirte Cuarda

• If you owe more than €75,000, the court proceedings must be brought in the High Court; proceedings are started when you are served with a Summary Summons by the creditor; the procedure is governed by the Rules of the Superior Courts

• Má tá níos mó ná €75,000 ort, ní mór na himeachtaí cúirte a thionól san Ardchúirt; cuirfear tús le himeachtaí nuair a dhéanfaidh an creidiúnaí Toghairm Achomair a sheirbheáil ort; tá an nós imeachta seo faoi réir Rialacha na hUaschúirte
The procedures and the documents which are used are different depending on which court is involved and sometimes on which kind of debt is involved
Bíonn na nósanna imeachta agus na cáipéisí a úsáidtear éagsúil ag brath ar an gcúirt atá i gceist agus ar an gcineál fiachais atá i gceist uaireanta
The proceedings are started by the person to whom you owe money
Cuireann an duine a bhfuil an t-airgead aige/aici ort tús leis na himeachtaí
That person (or group of people or company) is the creditor and the claimant or plaintiff in the case
Is é an duine sin (nó grúpa daoine nó cuideachta) an creidiúnaí agus an gearánaí sa chás
You are the debtor and the respondent or defendant in the case
Is tusa an féichiúnaí agus an cosantóir sa chás
In general, you are served with documents that set out the details of what you owe
De ghnáth, seirbheálfar cáipéisí ort a leagann amach sonraí an mhéid atá ort

You then have an opportunity to defend the action – this means that you must issue a replying document arguing that you do not owe the money, or that the contract is not valid, or whatever legal defence is open to you

Tá an deis agat an chaingean a chosaint ansin - ciallaíonn sé seo nach mór duit cáipéis freagartha a eisiúint ag argóint nach bhfuil an t-airgead ort nó nach bhfuil an conradh bailí nó cibé cosaint dhlíthiúil atá ar fáil duit
If you do not do anything, then there is little doubt that judgment will be awarded against you
Mura ndéanann tú aon rud, níl aon amhras ann go ndéanfar an breithiúnas i d’aghaidh
In general, if you are served with a document starting legal proceedings, you have 3 options:
De ghnáth, má sheirbheálfar an cháipéis ort a chuireann tús le himeachtaí cúirte, tá trí rogha agat:
• You usually have a number of days in which to pay the debt and the proceedings then do not start
• Tá roinnt laethanta agat chun an fiachas a íoc, agus ansin ní thosóidh na himeachtaí
The legal term is that the proceedings are stayed
Is é an téarma dlí go bhfuil na himeachtaí 'bactha'
• If you cannot pay what is owed and you have no defence, you may consent to an order being made
• Mura féidir leat an méid atá ort a íoc agus níl aon chosaint agat, is féidir leat an t-ordú a thoiliú
• If you intend to defend the action, you must serve the necessary replying documents
• Má tá sé ar intinn agat an chaingean a chosaint, ní mór duit na cáipéisí riachtanacha freagartha a sheirbheáil
Then a date is usually set for a hearing and the matter is decided at the hearing
De ghnáth, socrófar dáta le haghaidh éisteachta ansin agus déanfar cinneadh ar an gceist ag an éisteacht
If the matter in issue is covered by consumer credit legislation, then the person to whom you owe the money (the creditor) must issue a notice to you at least 10 days before taking legal action

Má chlúdaítear an t-ábhar i gceist faoi reachtaíocht chreidmheasa tomhaltóra, ní mór don duine a bhfuil an t-airgead aige/aici ort ('an creidiúnaí') fógra a eisiúint duit deich lá ar a laghad roimh an gcaingean dlí a thógáil
This notice must outline:
Caithfidh an fógra seo breac-chuntas a thabhairt ar:
• The name and address of the creditor or owner
• Ainm agus seoladh an chreidiúnaí nó an úinéara;
• Your name and address
• D'ainm agus do sheoladh;
• The term of the agreement to be enforced and
• Théarma an chomhaontaithe le cur i bhfeidhm, agus

• A statement of the action the creditor intends to take to enforce the agreement, the manner and circumstances in which he/she intends to take this action and the date on or after which such action will be taken

• Ráiteas ar an mbeart a dhéanfaidh an creidiúnaí chun an comhaontú a fhorfheidhmiú, an bealach agus na himthosca ina mbeidh an chaingean seo á tógáil agus an dáta ar a dtógfaidh caingean den sórt sin
If the consumer credit legislation does not apply, then it is the usual practice for creditors to send a seven-day demand letter to you before starting legal proceedings
Más rud é nach bhfuil reachtaíocht chreidmheasa tomhaltóra i gceist, de ghnáth, seolfaidh do chreidiúnaithe litir éilimh chugat seacht lá roimh thús na himeachtaí dlíthiúla
This, however, is not a legal requirement
Ní riachtanas dlí é seo, áfach
You, as the debtor, are generally liable for the costs of the court action
Is tusa, mar an bhféichiúnaí, a bheidh faoi dhliteanas chostais na caingne cúirte de ghnáth
The procedural rules are set out in the District Court Rules
Tá na rialacha a bhaineann le nósanna imeachta leagtha amach i Rialacha na Cúirte Dúiche
In general, the legal proceedings must be started in the District Court area in which you live or in which the contract was made
De ghnáth, caithfear na himeachtaí dlíthiúla a thosú i gceantar na Cúirte Dúiche ina bhfuil tú i do chónaí nó ina ndearnadh an conradh
However, if the contract comes within the Consumer Credit Act 1995, the proceedings may be brought only in the District Court area in which you live
Mar sin féin, má thagann an conradh faoin Acht um Chreidmheas do Thomhaltóirí 1995, ní féidir na himeachtaí a thionól ach amháin i gceantar na Cúirte Dúiche ina bhfuil tú i do chónaí
District Court proceedings are started when the creditor issues a claim notice to you
Cuirtear tús le himeachtaí na Cúirte Dúiche nuair a eisíonn an creidiúnaí Toghairm Shibhialta duit
This notice states the creditor’s claim, for example, that you owe him €5,000 for goods bought on a specific date
Leagann an toghairm dáta amach ar a mbeidh na himeachtaí ag tosú – tugtar 'dáta fillte' air seo
The notice gives you 2 options:
Tugann an toghairm trí rogha duit:
• If you pay the amount claimed within 10 days of the service of the claim notice, you will not have to go to court
• Má íocann tú an méid éilithe laistigh de 10 lá ó lá ar ar seirbheáladh an toghairm, ní thosóidh na himeachtaí;
• If you intend to dispute the claim, you must notify the claimant of your intention to do so within 28 days of receiving the notice; you use an appearance and defence form to do this

• Má tá sé ar intinn agat agóid i gcoinne an éilimh, ní mór duit do rogha a chur in iúl don chúirt laistigh de 7 lá tar éis an toghairm a fháil; ba chóir duit an 'Fógra go bhfuiltear chun Cosaint a dhéanamh' a úsáid, atá iniata leis an toghairm; más rud é nach ndéanann tú é seo, ní féidir leat dul go dtí an chúirt agus iarracht a dhéanamh cosaint a chur isteach

The claim notice may be served on you in person at your home or by registered post. If it is not possible to serve the notice in one of these ways, the creditor may ask the District Court to allow substituted service – this means that it may be served in some other way, for example, by ordinary post

• Má ghlacann tú go bhfuil an t-airgead ort ach ba mhaith leat níos mó ama a fháil chun é a íoc, léiríonn an toghairm cad is gá duit a dhéanamh; ní mór duit dul go dtí aturnae an chreidiúnaí laistigh de 10 lá, agus foirm toilithe a shíniú
If this does not succeed, for example, because the creditor does not know your current address, the creditor may ask the court to deem the notice to have been properly served
I gcásanna áirithe, is féidir leat toiliú a thabhairt chun an fiachas a íoc trí thráthchodanna
The creditor must then provide proof of service either by oral evidence to the court or by a statutory declaration of service
Caithfear an toghairm shibhialta a sheirbheáil ort ar a laghad 21 lá roimh an dáta fillte
Any such documents must be lodged with the District Court clerk at least 4 days before the court hearing
Féadfar é a sheirbheáil go pearsanta ag do theach nó tríd an bpost cláraithe
If you do not indicate your intention to defend the proceedings, there is no hearing and the creditor gets a judgment that you owe the money
Caithfidh an creidiúnaí cruthúnas seirbhíse a sholáthar ansin cé acu an bhfuil sé sin trí fhianaise béil don chúirt nó trí dhearbhú reachtúil seirbhíse
The creditor files with the District Court Clerk:
Ní mór aon cháipéis den sórt sin a chur isteach chuig cléireach na Cúirte Dúiche ceithre lá roimh an dáta fillte ar a laghad
• An affidavit or statutory declaration of service of the claim notice
Mura gcuireann tú in iúl go bhfuil tú chun na himeachtaí a chosaint, ní bheidh éisteacht ar bith agus gheobhaidh an creidiúnaí breithiúnais go bhfuil an t-airgead aige ort
• A certificate of no appearance/defence • An affidavit of debt verifying the creditor’s claim • A District Court decree
Comhdaíonn an creidiúnaí Mionnscríbhinn Fiachais agus Forógra na Cúirte Dúiche le Cléireach na Cúirte Dúiche
There are different forms of affidavit depending on the kind of debt involved
Tá cineálacha éagsúla mionnscríbhinne ag brath ar an gcineál fiachais atá i gceist
These documents constitute the District Court judgment set
Is iad na cáipéisí seo sraith bhreithiúnais na Cúirte Dúiche
These are then checked and, if all documents are in order, the judge of the District Court issues the judgment
Déantar iad seo a sheiceáil agus, más rud é go bhfuil na cáipéisí go léir in ord, eisíonn Breitheamh na Cúirte Dúiche an breithiúnas
The judgment is for the amount owed plus the costs involved in the proceedings
Baineann an breithiúnas leis an méid atá ort chomh maith leis na costais a bhí ar na himeachtaí
Interest at the rate of 2% begins to run on the amount of the judgment (but not the costs) from the day the judgment is given
Agus an breithiúnas bainte amach, tá an creidiúnaí i dteideal an breithiúnas a fhorghníomhú ansin
This interest rate was reduced from 8% by the Courts Act 1981 (Interest on Judgment Debts) Order 2016, which came into effect on 1 January 2017
Tosaítear ag cur úis ar ráta de 8% le méid an bhreithiúnais (seachas na costais) ón lá a dtugtar an breithiúnas
If you defend the proceedings
Má dhéanann tú agóid i gcoinne na n-imeachtaí
If you are defending the proceedings and have sent your form indicating your intention to defend, then the creditor serves a notice of trial on you at least 10 days before the court hearing
Má tá tú chun agóid i gcoinne na n-imeachtaí agus tá tú tar éis d'fhoirm a chuireann in iúl go bhfuil sé ar intinn agat cosaint a sheoladh, éistfear an cás os comhair bhreitheamh na Cúirte Dúiche
At the hearing, the judge hears the arguments from the creditor and from you and makes a decision
Éisteann an breitheamh leis na hargóintí ón gcreidiúnaí agus uait, agus a déanann sé a chinneadh
That could be to make a judgment in favour of the creditor or to dismiss the action
D'fhéadfadh sé breithiúnas a thabhairt i bhfabhar an chreidiúnaí nó an chaingean a dhíbirt
If the judge considers that you cannot pay the amount through no fault of yours, the judge may grant a stay of execution for a period of time
Má mheasann an breitheamh nach féidir leat an méid a íoc gan aon locht ortsa, féadann an breitheamh bac ar fhorghníomhú a dheonú ar feadh tréimhse ama
The judge may make an order for payment by instalments
Féadann an breitheamh ordú a dhéanamh go ndéanfaidh tú íocaíochtaí trí thráthchodanna chomh maith
If you do not defend the proceedings, there is no hearing so it is highly unlikely that a stay of execution or payment by instalments will be granted
Mura ndéanann tú agóid i gcoinne na n-imeachtaí, ní bheidh éisteacht ar bith agus mar sin, ní dócha go ndeonófar bac ar fhorghníomhú nó íocaíocht trí thráthchodanna
The procedure is broadly similar to that which applies in the District Court but there are some differences in the documents which are used
Tá an nós imeachta seo an-chosúil le nósanna imeachta na Cúirte Dúiche, ach tá roinnt difríochtaí ann idir na cáipéisí a úsáidtear
The rules are set out in the Circuit Court rules
Tá na rialacha leagtha amach i rialacha na Cúirte Cuarda
The proceedings start with the creditor serving an ordinary civil bill on you
Cuirtear tús leis na himeachtaí nuair a dhéanann an creidiúnaí gnáthbhille sibhialta a sheirbheáil ort
This is broadly similar to the claim notice used in the District Court
Tá sé seo cosúil leis an toghairm shibhialta a úsáidtear sa Chúirt Dúiche
The claim being made by the creditor is set out in the indorsement of claim
Tá an t-éileamh atá á dhéanamh ag an gcreidiúnaí leagtha amach san Fhormhuiniú Éilimh
This must set out the details such as the date and the content of the contract
Ní mór dó na sonraí a bhaineann leis an gcás a leagan amach, mar shampla, an dáta agus ábhar an chonartha
The civil bill states that, if you want to defend the case, you must enter an appearance within 10 days
Deir an bille sibhialta nach mór duit láithreas a thaifeadadh os comhair cúirte laistigh de 10 lá más mian leat an cás a chosaint,
This period can be extended by agreement or by direction of the court
Is féidir an tréimhse sin a shíneadh de bharr comhaontú nó ordú na cúirte
Entering an appearance means that you must lodge a specified form with the County Registrar and give a copy to the creditor or his solicitor
Ciallaíonn “láithreas a thaifeadadh os comhair cúirte” go gcaithfidh tú foirm shonraithe a thabhairt do Chláraitheoir an Chontae agus cóip a thabhairt don chreidiúnaí nó dá aturnae chomh maith
The County Registrar organises the business of the Circuit Court and has a broadly similar role to that of the Clerk of the District Court
Eagraíonn Cláraitheoir an Chontae gnó na Cúirte Cuarda agus tá ról aige atá cosúil le ról Chléireach na Cúirte Dúiche
If you do not propose to defend the action, you may consent to the claim in the same way as in the District Court
Mura bhfuil tú chun agóid a dhéanamh i gcoinne na caingne, is féidir leat toiliú leis an éileamh ar an mbealach céanna atá sa Chúirt Dúiche
If you do not enter an appearance or if you enter an appearance and then do not deliver a defence, the creditor may apply to the court for a judgment in default of appearance

Mura ndéanann tú láithreas a thaifeadadh os comhair cúirte nó má dhéanann tú láithreas a thaifeadadh os comhair cúirte ach ní sheachnaíonn tú cosaint ansin, is féidir leis an gcreidiúnaí iarraidh ar an gCúirt le haghaidh 'Breithiúnas Mainneachtana'
This judgment is given if the relevant documents are lodged by the creditor
Tugtar an breithiúnas seo más rud é go bhfuil na cáipéisí ábhartha taiscthe ag an gcreidiúnaí
It seems that some County Registrars require that the creditor give you 14 days' warning notice of such an application but this is not a legal requirement
Dealraíonn sé go dteastaíonn ó roinnt Cláraitheoirí Contae go dtabharfadh an creidiúnaí fógra rabhaidh de 14 lá duit i dtaobh iarratais den sórt seo ach ní ceanglas dlíthiúil é
The judgment is for the amount owed plus costs
Baineann an breithiúnas leis an méid atá ort chomh maith leis na costais a bhí ar na himeachtaí
Once the judgment has been granted, the creditor may then apply for an execution order in order to enforce the judgment
Tar éis don bhreithiúnas a thabhairt, féadfaidh an creidiúnaí iarratas a dhéanamh ar Ordú Forghníomhaithe ionas go mbeidh siad in ann an breithiúnas a fhorghníomhú
Proceedings in the High Court are started by means of a summary summons
Cuirtear tús le himeachtaí san Ard-Chúirt trí Thoghairm Achomair
In general, this must be served in person unless that is not reasonably practical
De ghnáth, ní mór é seo a sheirbheáil go pearsanta mura bhfuil sé sin praiticiúil go réasúnta
There are provisions for substituted service which are broadly similar to those in the District Court
Tá forálacha ann le haghaidh seirbheáil ionadach atá cosúil leo siúd atá sa Chúirt Dúiche
The summary summons must include an indorsement of claim
Caithfidh an toghairm achomair Formhuiniú Éilimh a chuimsiú
This sets out the amount which the creditor claims is owed plus costs
Leagann sé seo amach an méid a éilíonn an creidiúnaí go bhfuil ort chomh maith le costais
It also states that, if you pay within 6 days, the proceedings will not go ahead (the proceedings are stayed)
Deir sé, chomh maith, má íocann tú taobh istigh de sé lá, ní rachaidh na himeachtaí ar aghaidh (beidh na himeachtaí bactha)
If the creditor is a licensed moneylender, this fact must be stated in the indorsement of claim; other details about the loan agreement must also be stated, such as the applicable rate of interest

Más iasachtaí airgid ceadúnaithe é an creidiúnaí, ní mór dó é sin a lua i bhFormhuiniú an Éilimh; ní mór dó sonraí eile mar gheall ar an gcomhaontú iasachta a lua chomh maith, mar shampla an ráta úis infheidhme
You have 3 options:
Tá trí rogha agat:
• You may pay the amount owed plus costs within 6 days and the proceedings will not go ahead
• Is féidir leat an méid atá ort a íoc chomh maith le costais laistigh de sé lá agus ní rachaidh na himeachtaí ar aghaidh;
• You consent to judgment and ask for further time for payment
• Toilíonn tú leis an mbreithiúnas agus déanann tú iarratas ar thuilleadh ama chun íocaíochtaí a dhéanamh;
• You may defend the proceedings by entering an appearance
• Is féidir leat na himeachtaí a chosaint trí 'láithreas a thaifeadadh os comhair cúirte'
You do this by delivering a memorandum in writing to the Central Office of the Four Courts, Dublin within 8 days of the service of the summons
Chun é seo a dhéanamh, déanann tú meabhrán a sheachadadh i scríbhinn chuig Príomh-Oifig na Ceithre Cúirteanna, Baile Átha Cliath laistigh d'ocht lá ón lá ar ar seirbheáladh an toghairm
If you do not enter an appearance, the creditor may get judgment in default of appearance from the Central Office of the High Court
Mura ndéanann tú láithreas a thaifeadadh os comhair cúirte, is féidir leis an gcreidiúnaí breithiúnas mainneachtana a fháil ó Phríomh-Oifig na Ceithre Cúirteanna
In some cases, for example, moneylending agreements, the permission of the Master of the High Court is required before such a judgment can be granted
I gcásanna áirithe a bhaineann le comhaontuithe iasachtaithe airgid, bheadh cead Mháistir na hArd-Chúirte ag teastáil sula bhféadfaí breithiúnas mar sin a dheonú
If you do enter an appearance and defend the proceedings, then the case is heard by a High Court judge and judgment is given
Má dhéanann tú láithreas a thaifeadadh os comhair cúirte agus déanann tú agóid i gcoinne na n-imeachtaí, éistfidh Breitheamh na hArd-Chúirte an cás agus tabharfaidh sé breithiúnas
Usually, the creditor looks for an order of fieri facias at the same time
De ghnáth, lorgaíonn an creidiúnaí ordú fieri facias ag an am céanna
If the creditor gets a judgment against you, they are entitled to use various mechanisms to get the money from you
Má tá breithiúnas bainte amach ag creidiúnaí i do choinne, tá sé i dteideal an breithiúnas a fhorghníomhú ansin
Read more in our document on enforcement of judgments
Léigh a thuilleadh inár ndoiciméad ar Fhorfheidhmiú breithiúnas
